summary: This is an email chain from August 2019 discussing the scope of Jeffrey Epstein's 2008 Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA). The email forwards a 2008 plea hearing transcript where Epstein's attorney stated the NPA only applied to the Southern District of Florida, and discusses ongoing 2019 litigation where victims' attorneys argue the NPA does not extend to New York, opposing a motion by Epstein's lawyer for a sur-reply.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: Represented Jeffrey Epstein in the 2008 Florida state court hearing where Epstein pled guilty. Stated on the record that the NPA obligated the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida not to prosecute Epstein in that district.

persons.name: Marty Weinberg
persons.context: In 2019, filed a motion for a sur-reply in the Florida CVRA case, seeking to discuss the scope of the NPA.

persons.name: Judge Marra
persons.context: Presiding over the Florida CVRA case. Was poised to rule rapidly on the motion for a sur-reply and had asked for a quick response.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the 2008 NPA and guilty plea in Florida. His attorneys are involved in 2019 litigation concerning the scope of that agreement.

connections.description: Goldberger represented Epstein in the 2008 Florida state court plea hearing.
Weinberg represented Epstein in the 2019 CVRA litigation, filing motions regarding the NPA.

events.title: Epstein Florida Plea Hearing
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pled guilty to Florida state charges. During questioning by the judge, his attorney Jack Goldberger stated the NPA obligated the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida not to prosecute Epstein in that district.

events.title: Filing in Florida CVRA Case
events.description: Jane Doe 1 and 2 filed a reply brief on remedies in the Florida CVRA case, arguing Judge Marra must craft remedies solely for Florida crimes/victims because the NPA only covers Florida.

events.title: Motion for Sur-Reply by Epstein's Lawyer
events.description: Epstein's lawyer Marty Weinberg filed a motion for a sur-reply to discuss, among other things, the scope of the NPA.

keyFacts: In the 2008 plea hearing, Epstein's attorney Jack Goldberger explicitly stated the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) only applied to the Southern District of Florida.
In 2019, victims' attorneys argued in court that the NPA's scope was limited to Florida, and therefore remedies for CVRA violations should relate solely to Florida crimes and victims.
Epstein's 2019 attorney, Marty Weinberg, sought to file a sur-reply to further argue about the scope of the NPA, indicating ongoing legal dispute over its geographical applicability.
The email indicates victims were told as early as 2013 that the NPA did not extend to New York or other jurisdictions.
